item.title: Nuclearster add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Well-read people are less likely to be evil." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Nuclearster add a quote by Jostein Gaarder
item.description: "The question of whether a thing is right or wrong, good or bad, must always be considered in relation to a persons needs." -- Jostein Gaarder

item.title: Nuclearster add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Nuclearster add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "No human relation gives one possession in another—every two souls are absolutely different. In friendship or in love, the two side by side raise hands together to find what one cannot reach alone." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Nuclearster add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Music is the language of the spirit. It opens the secret of life bringing peace, abolishing strife." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Nuclearster add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Nuclearster add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Each man must look to himself to teach him the meaning of life. It is not something discovered: it is something molded." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
